text.autoconfig.yigd.title: You're in Grave Danger
text.autoconfig.yigd.option.graveSetting: If graves should be generated on death

How players can retrieve their items from graves
ON_USE: Right click the grave
ON_SNEAK: Sneak on top of th grave
ON_STAND: Step on top of the grave
ON_BREAK: Break the grave

How items should be retrieved from graves

IN_INVENTORY: Items go straight into your inventory,
in the same slots as when you died
ON_GROUND: All items land on the ground as
if you broke a chest

What inventory should be prioritized.
GRAVE: Your inventory will be
generated on top of grave inventory
INVENTORY: Grave inventory will be
generated on top of your inventory

Configure if and how other
players can retrieve your grave

If set to true, other
players will be able to loot
your grave

If set to true, only
the player that killed you can
rob your grave

Will decide after how long
grave robbing is possible.
Set to 0 to be instant

What inventory should be prioritized.
GRAVE: Your inventory will be
generated on top of grave inventory
INVENTORY: Grave inventory will be
generated on top of your inventory
If graves are allowed to expire
The time unit used by After Time
If true, grave will drop its items on despawn

Removes items with this enchantment from
the grave. Gives Curse of Vanishing
effect. Useful if soulbound items are
ignored and ends up in both
your inventory and your grave
Format: [namespace]:[enchantment_name]

Items with this enchantment will not
generate in graves, but be kept by the
player when they respawn.
Format: [namespace]:[enchantment_name]

Try to place grave using a block whitelist
Whitelist is a block tag located at
data/yigd/tags/blocks/soft_whitelist.json
Defaulted to air, water, and lava

Try to place grave using a block blacklist
Blacklist is a block tag located at
data/yigd/tags/blocks/replace_blacklist.json
Defaulted to bedrock only
This will be a more precise death
position than soft replace

Dimensions with their ID in this list
will not generate graves

You can see the dimension ID
in the bottom of the top left
F3 display (9th row from the top)
If a grave should generate when you fall into the void
What Y level a grave should spawn at when you die in the void

If no block can be overwritten with a
grave, what should happen with your items?

SET_GRAVE: Place a grave where you died (replace blacklisted block)
DROP_ITEMS: Drop all your items where you died
Set XP drop to minecraft default

How many percent of your XP
should be stored in the grave

This will only make a difference
if "Default XP Drop" is set to false

Config for the block generated under the grave,
if it spawn in the air

If a block should generate under
the grave if the grave spawns in the air or over the void
Whitelist can be specified at
data/yigd/tags/blocks/support_replace_whitelist.json

Block generated under grave
in the overworld dimension

Block generated under grave
in the nether dimension

Block generated under grave
in the end dimension

Block generated under grave
in custom dimensions

Render grave ground layer as
the block the grave is on top of

Send a message to a player
telling them where they died
text.autoconfig.yigd.option.utilitySetti:
If the mod should use the
built in soulbound enchant
[Require restart]
enchantment.yigd.soulbound.desc: Keep your items beyond the grave
